page.title: 19THE HESELTINE CRISIS
page.content: The rural and unspoilt parishes of Warfield and Binfield are at present under the threat of large scale development which would completely transform them. Michael Heseltine as Minister of Environment endorsed a plan to build 8000 houses in Central Berkshire, 4000 in the Bracknell area. Locally the plan is known as HESELTOWN. The Northern Parishes Action Group (NORPAG) is leading the campaign against the development. Patrick Jenkin the present Minister of the Environment and local M.P Andrew Mackay became interested in the plight of these parishes, the latter gaining the support of 86 M.P's in the Commons. They have attracted the public's attention to this problem through use of the media.
